H0.text: The circulatory system provides a major route for heat flow between the interior and exterior of the body.

H1.text: The excretory system provides a major route for heat flow between the interior and exterior of the body.

H2.text: The nervous system provides a major route for heat flow between the interior and exterior of the body.

H3.text: The respiratory system provides a major route for heat flow between the interior and exterior of the body.

A4.text: This process is useful to ectothermic (cold-blooded) animals in the regulation of their body temperature.
